title: Panic in nightly rustc_errors::CodeSuggestion::splice_lines

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
Full source file:
`fn x<T, '_, 'b>() {}`

Panic output:
```
x@y.z:~/repro$ RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo build
   Compiling repro v0.1.0 (/home/x/repro)
error: lifetime parameters must be declared prior to type parameters
 --> src/lib.rs:1:9
  |
1 | fn x<T, '_, 'b>() {}
  |         ^^  ^^
thread 'rustc' panicked at 'begin <= end (12 <= 10) when slicing `fn x<T, '_, 'b>() {}`', src/libcore/str/mod.rs:2085:5

error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

note: rustc 1.33.0-nightly (c2d381d39 2019-01-10) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

error: Could not compile `repro`.
```
